009package imagingbook.common.geometry.shape;
010
011import java.awt.Shape;
012import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
013import java.awt.geom.PathIterator;
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
019
020/**
021 * Implementing classes know how to create an AWT {@link Shape}.
022 * 
023 * @author WB
024 *
025 */
026public interface ShapeProducer {
027        
028        /**
029         * Returns a scaled {@link Shape} for this object
030         * (default scale is 1).
031         * Must be defined by implementing classes.
032         * The interpretation of the scale factor is left to the implementing class.
033         * For example, for {@link Pnt2d} it specifies the size of the marker 
034         * (see {@link Pnt2d#getShape(double)}.
035         * 
036         * @param scale the scale of the shape
037         * @return a {@link Shape} instance
038         */
039        public Shape getShape(double scale);
040        
041        /**
042         * Returns a {@link Shape} for this object at the
043         * default scale (1).
044         * @return a {@link Shape} instance
045         */
046        public default Shape getShape() {
047                return getShape(1);
048        };
049        
050        /**
051         * Returns a fixed sequence of {@link Shape} items for drawing this object,
052         * which must contain at least one item.
053         * This is to produce graphic representations that are too complex for
054         * a single {@link Shape} item.
055         * The returned shapes may also be displayed with different strokes or colors.
056         * <p>
057         * By default, this method returns a single item which is the primary
058         * shape (obtained by {@link #getShape(double)}).
059         * Implementing classes should override this method if more than one
060         * shape must be returned 
061         * For example, a {@link GeometricEllipse} returns three shape items:
062         * (a) the ellipse curve, (b) the center mark, (c) the major axes
063         * (see {@link GeometricEllipse#getShapes(double)}).
064         * </p>
065         * 
066         * @param scale a scale factor (may be used or ignored)
067         * @return sequence of {@link Shape} items
068         */
069        public default Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
070                return new Shape[] { getShape(scale) };
071        }
072        
073        public default Shape[] getShapes() {
074                return getShapes(1);
075        }
076        
077        // TODO: experimental
078        public static Pnt2d[] getShapePoints(Shape shape) {
079            double[] coords = new double[6];
080            PathIterator pathIterator = shape.getPathIterator(null);
081
082            List<Pnt2d> points = new ArrayList<>();
083            
084            while (!pathIterator.isDone()) {
085                int segmentType = pathIterator.currentSegment(coords);
086                switch (segmentType) {
087                
088                case PathIterator.SEG_MOVETO :
089                    System.out.printf("move to x1=%f, y1=%f\n", coords[0], coords[1]);
090                    points.add(Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]));
091                    break;
092                    
093                case PathIterator.SEG_LINETO :
094                    System.out.printf("line to x1=%f, y1=%f\n", coords[0], coords[1]);
095                    points.add(Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]));
096                    break;
097                    
098                case PathIterator.SEG_QUADTO :
099                    System.out.printf("quad to x1=%f, y1=%f, x2=%f, y2=%f\n", coords[0], coords[1], coords[2], coords[3]);
100                    points.add(Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]));
101                    break;
102                    
103                case PathIterator.SEG_CUBICTO :
104                    System.out.printf("cubic to x1=%f, y1=%f, x2=%f, y2=%f, x3=%f, y3=%f\n",
105                            coords[0], coords[1], coords[2], coords[3], coords[4], coords[5]);
106                    points.add(Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]));
107                    break;
108                    
109                case PathIterator.SEG_CLOSE :
110                    System.out.printf("close\n");
111                    break;
112                    
113                default : throw new RuntimeException("unknown path segment type " + segmentType);
114                }
115                
116                
117                pathIterator.next();
118            }
119            return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[points.size()]);
120        }
121        
122        
123}
